hints.content: Start by understanding the problem statement clearly. You need to convert all uppercase letters in the string to their lowercase counterparts. Remember, lowercase letters should remain unchanged.
Consider the properties of the string. The input will always consist of printable ASCII characters, which means you don't have to handle any special or non-ASCII characters.
Think about how you can iterate through each character in the string. You might want to use a loop to access each character one by one.
When checking if a character is uppercase, consider using the ASCII values. For example, uppercase letters range from 'A' (65) to 'Z' (90).
Alternatively, many programming languages offer built-in functions to convert characters to lowercase. Explore if your language of choice has such a method.
Remember to handle the case where the string may already be in lowercase. Your solution should not alter characters that are already lowercase.
Think about the output format. You need to return a new string with the converted characters. This means you might need to collect the converted characters into a new string.
Consider edge cases, such as when the string is already all lowercase or contains no uppercase letters at all. What should your function return in these scenarios?
You could use a list to store the characters as you convert them and then join them together at the end to form the final string.

Finally, put together your approach. For each character in the string, check if it's uppercase. If it is, convert it to lowercase; if not, keep it the same. Return the final string after processing all characters.

questionNotes: s consists of printable ASCII characters.
Output should be a new string with all uppercase letters converted to lowercase.
